Package work.teamteam.mockery

Class Matchers

java.lang.Object
work.teamteam.mockery.Matchers
public class Matchers
extends java.lang.Object
Matching logic so we can specify the return value of mocks when specific parameters are passed. E.g when(foo.callMethod(eq(1), any()).thenReturn(100);

    • eq

      public static <T> T eq​(T t)
      returns true if the parameter matches t. If t == null this is equivalent to Matchers::isNull(), otherwise it checks param -> t.equals(param)
      Type Parameters:
      T - generic type we're capturing
      Parameters:
      t - primitive to match
      Returns:
      Default return value for T

    • capture

      public static <T> T capture​(Capture<T> capture)
      Used alongside verify to extract values of a given parameter. E.g final Capture<Integer> capture = Capture.of(Integer.class); verify(foo, 1).doSomething(capture(capture)); assertEquals(100, capture.tail()); // get the last value passed to foo.doSomething(int)
      Type Parameters:
      T - generic type of this parameter we'll capture
      Parameters:
      capture - capture to register
      Returns:
      Default return value for T

    • matches

      public static <T> T matches​(java.util.function.Predicate<T> condition)
      only matches parameters that match the condition
      Type Parameters:
      T - generic type of the parameter
      Parameters:
      condition - condition to match
      Returns:
      null (we don't have type info to do much else safely)

    • getMatchers

      public static java.util.function.Predicate<java.lang.Object>[] getMatchers()
      INTERNAL: returns the current matchers and resets the global list
      Returns:
      list of matcher predicates used since the last global reset
